During holiday and peak travel periods,

minutes to park and connect with
your flight.

information.
Have your parking ticket ready when
exiting the airport.
Do not lose your parking ticket. You
will be required to pay $9.00 (terminal
rate for each day your vehicle was

Shuttle

D
allas/Fort Worth
International Airport
provides tours five days
a week for men's and
women's service organizations,
airport study groups, travel
agents, technically-oriented
organizations, church groups,
handicapped, mentally
retarded, hospital groups,
senior citizens, airline
personnel, and local school
groups.
Tours can be arranged to fit
the special interests of each
group. Occasionally tours are
offered for high school
students or college youths
interested in aviation careers.
The vast majority of
requests come from the local
school system, but we build
the tour around the interests
of individuals visiting the
Airport. These vary in length
and are tailored where
possible to meet the special
interest or the needs of the
persons or person touring the
Airport.
A VIP tour could be a group
of engineers from Japan,
architectural students from a
University, a head of state or
a cabinet level official.

Tour
the
Dallas/Fart Worth
International
Airport

Rent Car Service
Simply follow overhead signs to auto rental
counters located near baggage claim areas. At
each counter direct phone service is available
to the four rental companies which serve DFW.
Rental car facilities are located in both the
north and south reduced rate parking areas
It is here the actual transaction and car pickup
takes place. You may ride AIRTRANS or a
courtesy van to the rent car buildings.
You will be given a parking ticket when you
receive your car. If you leave the Airport within
one hour, there will be no charge.
There are no return facilities at the terminals.
Please take your rent car to the proper return
area. Signs along International Parkway will
direct you to these areas.
Bus and Taxi Service
Bus, limousine and taxi service to Dallas, Fort
Worth and area hotels and motels is available
at curbside near baggage claim areas at Air-
port Terminals 2E, 3E, 4E and 2W. Taxicab ser-
vice is available at all upper-level curbside exits
Fares to downtown Dallas or Fort Worth are
about $20 (U.S.). Ground transportation be
tween the Airport and metroplex area locations
and destinations are provided by numerous
companies. For additional ground transporta-
tion information telephone Transportation Regu-
lation at 574-5878 or 670-3161.

properties.sfomuseum:creditline: Transfer from San Francisco International Airport
properties.sfomuseum:description: Airport information packet issued by Dallas / Fort Worth International Airport; folder containing various brochures and pamphlets;a. folder; two pockets; color photographic image on cover of control tower in low light, with square metal piece adhered to front;b. brochure titled “A 4 billion dollar impact”; bi-fold format; white and green cover; interior text and graphs explain value of the airport to the community;c. periodical titled “The official visitors guide to the Dallas/Fort Worth area; 53 pages; beige cover with color photographic images; dated spring/summer 1987;d. brochure titled “Your guide to international travel”; quad-fold format; beige cover with color illustration of Boeing 747; includes information in English, French, German, Spanish, Japanese, Farsi;e. brochure, map; bi-fold format; includes maps and route for parking, airport shuttle, and bus service;f. brochure titled “Tour the Dallas/Fort Worth Airport”; tri-fold format; orange and green cover; interior text and images explain tour schedules and process;g. brochure titled “DFW guide”; fold-out format; white and blue cover; includes terminal map and contact information;h. brochure titled “Airtrans / Intra-airport transit; bi-fold format; white and green cover with color photographic image of airtrans car; includes information about the system.
